messages.message:
I have been noticing this issue in AI Hub Build where when I load a pre-built schema for the first time, it seems to repeatedly make the same requests to save until I refresh the page. Wondering if this was on the radar
cc @Paul H @Sherif
i'm having trouble reproducing the bug - were there any prerequisite steps you did to trigger it?
The bug is that requests are repeatedly being made
You did reproduce it, you can see that the loading spinner never goes away, and in the network tab if you remove all filters and you'll see that the same set of requests are being made repeatedly
And never stops until you refresh the page
for me it always stops refetching after 3 requests. I'm having trouble making it infinitely refetching atm
Interesting, I'm not sure can you try Driver License and Passport?

oh yeah i see it. It only occurs for Driver License and Passport. For some reason we are constantly passing in  `new_fields` array of "Date of Birth" and "Gender" fields even though they aren't new anymore.

have a fix (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/73235) ready - the issue was there was some field id collision issue when two classes share the same field names, in this case "Date of Birth" and "Gender".
